suggestions.title: Suggestions and
suggestions.description: Prepare for a safe and memorable experience with our essential recommendations.

1.title: Wear comfortable clothes
1.description: Use hiking clothes and suitable shoes. Layers are important for temperature changes.

2.title: Constant hydration
2.description: Carry enough water. At least 2 liters per person is recommended for routes longer than 3 hours.

3.title: Best time for photos
3.description: Sunrise and sunset offer the best lighting. Avoid midday for better results.

4.title: Respect the environment
4.description: Do not leave trash, do not pull up plants, and maintain distance from wildlife.

5.title: Check the weather
5.description: Check the forecast before heading out. Conditions can change quickly in the mountains.

6.title: Don't go alone
6.description: It is safer to explore in groups. If you go alone, inform someone of your route and estimated return time.

footer.description: Discover the natural beauty of the Sierra Negra. A unique experience in contact with nature.

hero.title: High-Altitude Flavors
hero.subtitle: Authentic flavors from Sierra Negra, directly to your table.

filters.no_results: We couldn't find what you're looking for.

z1.name: Zoquitlán Heirloom Peach
z1.description: Sweet and juicy peach, grown in the highlands of Zoquitlán. Ideal for jams or fresh consumption.

z2.name: Small Heirloom Avocado
z2.description: Avocado with edible skin, intense flavor, and creamy texture. Locally known as 'pagua' or 'aguacatillo'.

c1.name: Coyomeapan Golden Apple
c1.description: Crispy and aromatic apple, grown in the mist of Coyomeapan. Perfect for desserts.

e1.name: Eloxochitlán High-Altitude Coffee
e1.description: Strict high-altitude Arabica coffee, with chocolate and citrus notes. Hand-roasted medium roast.

e2.name: Organic Cinnamon Sticks
e2.description: Freshly harvested cinnamon, intense and sweet aroma. Long sticks hand-selected.

e3.name: Homemade Orange Jam
e3.description: Made with local oranges and cane sugar. No artificial preservatives.

e4.name: Black Beans from the Sierra
e4.description: Native black beans, quick-cooking and thick broth. Unmatched flavor.

e5.name: Smoked Dried Chili
e5.description: Chili sun-dried and smoked with oak wood. Medium heat and great aroma.
